intro: Crotalaria lonchophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf false cowpea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which is characterized by its legume pods and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender, branched stems and small, yellow flowers. Its leaves are alternate and pinnately compound, with narrow, lance-shaped leaflets. The seeds are enclosed in elongated, slender pods, which contribute to its common name.
